1.verse: From Paul and Timothy [2:19–24; Acts 16:1–5; 1 Cor. 16:10–11; 1 and 2 Timothy], ·servants [slaves; bondservants] of Christ Jesus. To all of ·God’s holy people [the saints] in Christ Jesus who live in Philippi [a city located in Macedonia, present-day northern Greece; Acts 16], including your ·overseers [bishops; perhaps the same as elders] and ·deacons [servants; ministers]:

2.verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: Paul’s Prayer - I thank my God every time I remember you,

4.verse: always praying with joy for all of you.

5.verse: I thank God for ·the help you gave me [your partnership/participation] in ·spreading the Good News [the Good News/Gospel] from the first day you believed until now.

6.verse: God began doing a good work in you, and I am ·sure [confident; persuaded] he will continue it until it is ·finished [completed; perfected] ·when Jesus Christ comes again [on the day of Christ Jesus; the final day of judgment and reward].

7.verse: And I know that I am right to think like this about all of you, because ·I have you in my [or you have me in your] heart. All of you ·share [are partners/co-sharers] in God’s grace with me while I am in ·prison [chains; Paul is probably writing from house arrest in Rome, about AD 60; see Acts 28:30–31] and while I am defending and ·proving the truth of [confirming] the ·Good News [Gospel].

8.verse: [For] God ·knows [is my witness] that I ·want [long] to see you very much, because I love all of you with the ·love [affection] of Christ Jesus.

9.verse: This is my prayer for you: that your love will ·grow [increase; abound] more and more; that you will have knowledge and ·understanding [insight; discernment] with your love;

10.verse: that you will ·see the difference between good and bad and will choose the good [discern/test and prove what is best]; that you will be pure and ·without wrong [blameless] ·for the coming [in the day; v. 6] of Christ;

11.verse: that you will be filled with the ·good things produced in your life by Christ [fruit of righteousness that comes through Christ] to bring glory and praise to God.

12.verse: Paul’s Troubles Help the Work - I want you brothers and sisters to know that what has happened to me has helped to ·spread [advance] the ·Good News [Gospel].

13.verse: All the ·palace guards [imperial guard; praetorium; Caesar’s elite troops] and everyone else knows that I am in ·prison [chains] ·because I am a believer in [or for the cause of] Christ.

14.verse: Because I am in prison, most of the ·believers [brothers (and sisters)] have become more ·bold [confident] in the Lord and ·are not afraid [dare without fear] to speak the word of God.

15.verse: It is true that some preach about Christ because of ·jealousy [envy] and ·ambition [rivalry], but others preach about Christ because ·they want to help [of good will/intentions].

16.verse: They preach because they have love, and they know that ·God gave me the work of [I have been appointed for; or I have been put here (in prison) for] defending the ·Good News [Gospel].

17.verse: But the others preach about Christ for ·selfish [selfish ambition; or rivalry] and ·wrong reasons [not sincerely], wanting to make trouble for me in ·prison [my chains].

18.verse: ·But it doesn’t matter [What difference does it make? or What is the result? For what?]. The important thing is that in every way, whether ·for right or wrong reasons [from false motives or true], they are preaching about Christ. So ·I am happy [in this I rejoice], ·and [indeed] I will continue to ·be happy [rejoice].

19.verse: Because I know ·this trouble [this] will ·bring my [result in] ·freedom [deliverance; or salvation], through your prayers and the ·help of [support from] the Spirit of Jesus Christ.

20.verse: I expect and hope that I will not ·fail Christ in [be ashamed about] anything but that I will have the ·courage [boldness] now, as always, ·to show the greatness of Christ [or so that Christ will be exalted] in my ·life here on earth [body], whether I live or die.

21.verse: [For] To me ·the only important thing about living [to live] is Christ, and ·dying would be profit for me [to die is gain/profit].

22.verse: If I continue living in my ·body [flesh], ·I will be able to work for the Lord [this is productive/fruitful work for me]. I do not know what to choose—living or dying.

23.verse: ·It is hard to choose [I am torn/hard pressed] between the two. I ·want [desire; long] to leave this life and be with Christ, which is much better,

24.verse: but ·you need me here [or it is better for you that I remain] in ·my body [the flesh].

25.verse: Since I am sure of this, I know I will stay with you ·to help you grow and have [for your progress/success and] joy in your faith.

26.verse: […so that] ·You will be very happy [or Because of me, your confidence/pride will increase; Your boasting in me will abound] in Christ Jesus when I am with you again.

27.verse: ·Only one thing concerns me [or Whatever happens; Only]: Be sure that you ·live [conduct yourselves; live as citizens] in a way that ·brings honor to [is worthy of] the ·Good News [Gospel] of Christ. ·Then […so that] whether I come and ·visit [see] you or am away from you, I will hear that you are standing strong ·with one purpose [with one spirit; or in the one Spirit], that you work together ·as one [with one mind/soul] for the faith ·of [or that is; or in] the ·Good News [Gospel],

28.verse: and that you are not ·frightened [intimidated] in any way by ·those who are against you [your opponents]. All of this is ·proof [evidence; a sign] that ·your enemies [they] will be destroyed but that you will be saved. And ·this salvation [or this proof/evidence/sign; this] is from God.

29.verse: ·God gave you the honor [For it has been granted/given to you] not only of believing in Christ but also of suffering for him.

30.verse: You yourselves are having the same kind of struggles that you saw ·I had when I was with you [in me], and ·you hear that I am still having now [now hear in me].

1.verse: [Therefore,] ·Does your life in Christ give you strength? [If there is any encouragement in Christ…] ·Does his love comfort you? […if any comfort from (his) love…] ·Do we share together in the Spirit? […if any fellowship/sharing of the Spirit…] ·Do you have mercy and kindness? […if any mercy/affection and kindness/compassion…]

2.verse: ·If so […then], ·make me very happy [fulfill/complete my joy] by ·having the same thoughts [being like-minded/of one mind], sharing the same love, and having one ·mind [heart; soul] and ·purpose [goal; mind].

3.verse: When you do things, do not let ·selfishness [rivalry; selfish ambition] or pride be your guide. Instead, be humble and give more ·honor [regard; value] to others than to yourselves.

4.verse: Do not ·be interested only in your own life [look out for your own interests], but ·be interested in the lives of others [look out for others’ interests].

5.verse: Be Unselfish like Christ - In your lives you must ·think and act like [have the same attitude as] Christ Jesus. [What follows may be from an early Christian hymn.]

6.verse: ·Christ himself was like God in everything [Who, being in the form of God]. But he did not think that being equal with God was something to be ·used for his own benefit [or grasped; seized; held on to].

7.verse: But he ·gave up his place with God and made himself nothing [emptied himself]. He ·became like [took the form of] a ·servant [slave; bondservant] and was born ·as a man [in the likeness of humanity/men].

8.verse: And ·when he was living [being found in appearance/likeness] as a ·man [human being], he humbled himself and was fully obedient to God, even ·when that caused his [to the point of] death—death on a cross.

9.verse: So God ·raised [exalted] him to the highest place. God ·made his name [or gave him the name] ·greater than [far above] every other name

10.verse: so that every knee will bow to the name of Jesus— everyone in heaven, on earth, and under the earth.

11.verse: And ·everyone [every tongue] will confess that Jesus Christ is Lord and bring glory to God the Father.

12.verse: Be the People God Wants You to Be - My ·dear friends [beloved], you have always obeyed God when I was with you. It is even more important that you obey now while I am away from you. ·Keep on working to complete [Continue working out] your salvation with ·fear [awe; reverence] and trembling,

13.verse: because God is working in you ·to help you want to do and be able to do [both to will/desire and to work] what pleases him.

15.verse: Then you will be ·innocent [blameless] and ·without any wrong [innocent; pure; harmless], God’s children without ·fault [blemish; as are sacrificial animals]. ·But you are living with people that are crooked and evil […in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation; Deut. 32:5], among whom you shine like stars in the ·dark world [or sky; world].

16.verse: You ·offer [or hold firmly/fast to] the ·teaching that gives life [message/word of life]. So ·when Christ comes again [on the day of Christ; judgment day], I can ·be happy [be proud; boast] because I ·ran the race and won [did not run for nothing/in vain]. ·My work was not wasted […nor did I labor for nothing/in vain].

17.verse: Your faith makes you offer your lives as a sacrifice in serving God. [Even] If I ·have to offer my own blood [am poured out as a drink offering] with your sacrifice, I will be ·happy [rejoicing] and full of joy with all of you.

18.verse: You also should be ·happy [rejoicing] and full of joy with me.

19.verse: Timothy and Epaphroditus - I hope in the Lord Jesus to send Timothy to you soon. […so that] I will be ·happy [encouraged] to learn how you are.

20.verse: I have no one else like Timothy [1:1], who ·truly [genuinely] cares for you.

21.verse: Other people ·are interested only in their own lives [pursue their own interests/concerns], not ·in the work [the interests/concerns; the things] of Jesus Christ.

22.verse: You know ·the kind of person Timothy is [his tested and proven character]. You know he has served with me in ·telling the Good News [the Gospel], as a son serves his father.

23.verse: [Therefore] I ·plan [hope] to send him to you quickly when I know what will happen to me [probably referring to the outcome of Paul’s trial in Rome].

24.verse: I am ·sure [confident] ·that the Lord will help me to [in the Lord that I will] come to you soon.

25.verse: [But; or Meanwhile,] I thought ·I should [it necessary to] send back to you Epaphroditus [4:18], my ·brother in Christ [brother] and coworker, ·who serves with me in Christ’s army [and fellow soldier]. He was your messenger, sent as a ·servant [minister] to meet my needs.

26.verse: I am sending him because he ·wants very much to see [greatly misses; longs for] all of you. He is ·worried [distressed] because you heard that he was sick.

27.verse: Yes, he was sick, and nearly died, but God had mercy on him and me too so that I would not have ·more sadness [sorrow upon sorrow].

28.verse: I ·want very much [am very eager] to send him to you so that when you see him you can ·be happy [rejoice], and I can stop worrying about you.

29.verse: Welcome him in the Lord with much joy. Give honor to people like him,

30.verse: because he almost died for the work of Christ. He risked his life to give me the help you could not give in your service to me.

1.verse: The Importance of Christ - [Furthermore, or Finally,] My brothers and sisters, ·be full of joy [rejoice] in the Lord. It is no trouble for me to write the same things to you again, and it ·will help you to be more ready [is a safeguard/protection for you].

2.verse: ·Watch out for [Beware] those who do evil, ·who are like dogs [beware the dogs; a derogatory reference to Paul’s opponents], ·who demand to cut the body [beware the mutilation; a mocking reference to those who demand circumcision of Gentile believers].

3.verse: [For] We are the ·ones who are truly circumcised [(true) circumcision]. We ·worship [serve] God ·through [or in] his Spirit, and ·our pride is [we boast/glory] in Christ Jesus. We do not put ·trust [reliance; confidence] in ·ourselves or anything we can do [human ability/effort; the flesh],

4.verse: although I might be able to put ·trust [reliance; confidence] in ·myself [human ability/effort; the flesh]. If anyone thinks he has a reason to ·trust [rely; have confidence] in ·himself [human ability/effort; the flesh], he should know that I have greater reason.

5.verse: I was circumcised eight days after my birth [Gen. 17:12; Lev. 12:3]. I am from the people of Israel and the tribe of Benjamin. I am a ·Hebrew, and my parents were Hebrews [or true Hebrew; Hebrew through and through; Hebrew of Hebrews]. With regard to the ·law of Moses [law], I was a Pharisee [Pharisees strictly followed the OT law and expanded on it with many traditions].

6.verse: ·I was so enthusiastic [With regard to (religious) zeal,] I persecuted the church. With regard to ·obedience to the law of Moses [righteousness based on the law] I was ·faultless [blameless].

7.verse: Those things were ·important [valuable; or assets] to me, but now I think they are ·worth nothing [or liabilities; a loss] because of Christ.

8.verse: Not only those things, but I think that all things are ·worth nothing [or liabilities; a loss] ·compared with [or because of] the ·greatness [superior/supreme value] of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. Because of him, I have lost all those things, and now I ·know they are [consider them] ·worthless trash [garbage; refuse; excrement]. ·This allows me to have […so that I may gain] Christ

9.verse: and to ·belong to [be united with; be found in] him. ·Now I am right with God, not because I followed the law […not having my own righteousness from the law], but because ·I believed in Christ [of faith in Christ; or of the faithfulness of Christ]. This is the ·right relationship with [or righteousness of/from] God that comes through ·faith [or the faithfulness (of Christ)].

10.verse: I want to know Christ and the power ·that raised him from the dead [of his resurrection]. I want to share in his sufferings and become like him in his death.

11.verse: ·Then I have hope that […if somehow] I myself will ·be raised [reach/attain to the resurrection] from the dead.

12.verse: Continuing Toward Our Goal - ·I do not mean [Not] that I have already ·achieved [obtained; taken hold of] it or have already ·been perfected [become mature; or reached the goal]. But I keep ·trying [pressing forward; striving; pursuing] to ·take hold of that for which [or make it my own because] Christ ·took hold of me [or made me his own].

13.verse: Brothers and sisters, I know that I have not ·yet reached that goal [taken hold of it], but there is one thing I always do. Forgetting the ·past [things that are behind] and ·straining toward [stretching/reaching forward to] what is ahead,

14.verse: I keep ·trying to reach [pursuing; chasing] the goal and get the prize for which God called me ·to the life above [heavenward; upward] ·through [or in] Christ Jesus.

15.verse: All of us who are ·spiritually mature [perfect; complete] should think this way, too. And if there are things you ·do not agree with [think differently about], God will ·make them clear [or reveal this] to you.

16.verse: But we should ·continue following the truth [or live up to the standard] we already have.

17.verse: Brothers and sisters, ·all of you should try to follow my example [become imitators of me] and ·to copy [watch closely; pay attention to] those who ·live [walk] the way we ·showed [modeled it for] you.

18.verse: [For] Many people ·live [walk] like enemies of the cross of Christ. I have often told you about them, and ·it makes me cry to [with tears I] tell you about them now.

19.verse: ·In the end, they will be destroyed [Their end/destiny is destruction]. ·They do whatever their bodies want [Their god is their stomach/belly], ·they are proud of their shameful acts [their glory is in their shame], and they think only about earthly things.

20.verse: But our ·homeland [or citizenship] is in heaven, and we are waiting for our Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ, to come from heaven.

21.verse: By his power to ·rule [subject to himself] all things, he will ·change [transform; transfigure] our humble bodies and make them like his own glorious body.

1.verse: What the Christians Are to Do - [Therefore; So then] My brothers and sisters, ·I love you and want to see you [my beloved and longed-for ones]. ·You bring me joy and make me proud of you […my joy and crown; 1 Thess. 2:19; a wreath bestowed for victory or honor], so stand ·strong [firm] in the Lord as I have told you, ·dear friends [beloved].

2.verse: I ·ask [urge; encourage; exhort] Euodia and Syntyche [two women in the Philippian congregation] to agree in the Lord.

3.verse: And I ask you, my ·faithful [true; genuine] ·friend [companion; yoke-partner; possibly a proper name: Syzygos], to help these women. They ·served [struggled; labored] with me in telling the ·Good News [Gospel], together with Clement and ·others who worked with me [the rest of my coworkers], whose names are written in the book of life [Rev. 3:5; 21:27].

4.verse: ·Be full of joy [Rejoice] in the Lord always. I will say again, ·be full of joy [rejoice].

5.verse: Let everyone see that you are ·gentle [kind; considerate; patient]. The Lord is ·coming soon [or close at hand; near].

6.verse: Do not ·worry [be anxious] about anything, but pray and ·ask God for everything you need [or make your requests known to God], always giving thanks.

7.verse: And God’s peace, which ·is so great we cannot understand it [transcends/surpasses all comprehension], will ·keep [guard] your hearts and minds in Christ Jesus.

8.verse: [Finally; In conclusion; or Now then] Brothers and sisters, ·think about [focus your thoughts on; fill your minds with] things that are true and honorable and ·right [just] and pure and ·beautiful [lovely] and ·respected [commendable]. If there is anything that is ·good [morally excellent] and worthy of praise, ·think about [focus your thoughts on; fill your minds with] these things.

9.verse: Do what you learned and received and heard ·from [in] me, and what you saw ·me do [in me]. And the God ·who gives [of] peace will be with you.

10.verse: Paul Thanks the Christians - I ·am very happy [rejoiced greatly] in the Lord that you have ·shown [renewed; revived] your ·care [concern] for me again. You continued to ·care [be concerned] about me, but ·there was no way for you [you had no opportunity] to show it.

11.verse: I am not telling you this because I need anything. [For] I have learned to be ·satisfied [content] ·whatever the circumstances [or with whatever I have].

12.verse: I know how to live when I am ·poor [in humble circumstances], and I know how to live when I have plenty. I have learned the ·secret of being happy [secret] ·at any time in everything that happens [or in any and all circumstances], when I have enough to eat and when I go hungry, when I have ·more than I need [plenty; an abundance] and when I do not have enough.

13.verse: I can do all things through ·Christ, because he [the one who] gives me strength.

14.verse: ·But [However; Nevertheless] it was good that you ·helped [shared/partnered with] me ·when I needed it [in my trouble/trial].

15.verse: You Philippians remember ·when I first preached the Good News there [or when you first believed the Good News/Gospel; in the beginning of the Good News/Gospel; Acts 16:11–40]. When I left Macedonia [the northern part of present-day Greece; Acts 17:14–15], ·you were the only church that [no church except you alone] ·gave me help [shared/partnered with me in matters of giving and receiving; business terminology; the Philippians “invested” in Paul’s ministry and received back spiritual blessings].

16.verse: [For] Even when I was in Thessalonica [shortly after leaving Philippi; Thessalonica is southwest of Philippi; Acts 17:1–9] ·several times [both once and twice] you sent me things I needed.

17.verse: Really, it is not that I ·want to receive gifts from you [seek the gift], but I ·want you to have the good that comes from giving [seek the profit/fruit that increases to your account; more business terminology; v. 15].

18.verse: And now I have ·everything [or received full payment], and more. I ·have all I need [or am fully supplied/filled up], because Epaphroditus [2:25] brought your gifts to me. They are ·like a sweet-smelling offering to God [a fragrant aroma], a sacrifice that is acceptable and pleasing to him.

19.verse: [And] My God will ·meet [supply; fulfill] all of your needs ·from [according to] his ·wonderful riches [glorious riches; or riches in heaven/glory] in Christ Jesus.

20.verse: Glory to our God and Father forever and ever! Amen.

21.verse: Greet each ·of God’s people [saint] in Christ Jesus. ·Those [The brothers (and sisters)] who are with me send greetings to you.

22.verse: All of ·God’s people [the saints] greet you, particularly those from ·the palace of Caesar [Caesar’s household; the soldiers, slaves, and freedmen engaged in imperial service].

23.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with ·you all [your spirit].
